subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Milligan poems
msgSnippet: Nope, did much the same thing you did except I did a s/[^- a-zA-Z]+/ n/g. To be honest I m not entirely certain any more why I offered the word list. I just
messageBody:
Nope, did much the same thing you did except I did a s/[^-'a-zA-Z]+/\n/g.

To be honest I'm not entirely certain any more why I offered the word list.
I just saw the name Baum and thought "ooh, I've still got a copy of that
some where".
Spur of the moment email I guess. :)

John Cowan wrote:
>
> amd64_hacker scripsit:
>
> > Also, on re-reading my e-mail, it looks like I'm saying I have a word
> > list with Latin and QuikScript equivalents.
> > The word list is just the 2940 words in Latin I'm afraid, I never got
> > any further.
>
> Oh, I misunderstood.
>
> Good Ghu, you didn't develop that list by hand, did you? It's about
> a one-minute job with the Unix text toolkit:
>
> wget http://www.gutenberg.org/dirs/etext93/wizoz10.txt
> <http://www.gutenberg.org/dirs/etext93/wizoz10.txt>
> tr <wiz0z10.txt -c '[^a-zA-Z]' '\012' | sort -u >wizoz10.wordlist
>
> --
> You let them out again, Old Man Willow! John Cowan
> What you be a-thinking of? You should not be waking! cowan@...
> <mailto:cowan%40ccil.org>
> Eat earth! Dig deep! Drink water! Go to sleep!
> Bombadil is talking. http://ccil.org/~cowan <http://ccil.org/%7Ecowan>
>
>

To be honest I'm not entirely certain any more why I offered the word list.
I just saw the name Baum and thought "ooh, I've still got a copy of that
some where".
Spur of the moment email I guess. :)
